ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed writing and critical thinking skills. I learned a lot about a topic in history in which I previously had very little knowledge.
I learned about both Utopian and Dystopian philosophers and gained a better insight on both history and philosophy.
How to analyze texts through political and historical perspectives.
I gained knowledge into the societal pressures and tensions that existed throughout history in Western Society and how these factors influenced cultural perceptions of a utopia.
Close reading skills definitely strengthened. Additionally being able to dissect text for a meaning without needing too much context because another peer is responsible so its is very inclusive.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think throughout the course we covered a wide variety of topics and information. I think the course could benefit from a little bit more structure.

strengths:
-small class
-great discussions
-great professor
-good readings

weaknesses:
-readings can sometimes be long
Discussion based class makes understanding topics very easy.

Some major strengths were the thoughtful discussions, intimacy/comfort of the course, and creativity in the structure/assignments.
Some weaknesses were the amount of readings at the start of the course, but this became significantly more manageable later on upon the professor's adjustment of assignments.

Very laidback instructor but sometimes confusing to understand when things are expected. The class definitely took on a more go with the flow vibe but this allowed authentic conversation, and comfort.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely, if youre even remotely interested in philosophical and historical thought you should. Prof jordan is exceptional and so is the material!
I would recommend this course to another student as it was very interesting and informative.
yes it was a great class
Yes, the course helps you to think deeply about societal issues.

I would recommend this class to any other student if they're prepared to think and talk about complicated issues. I think that the material is valuable regardless of one's field of study as almost every human being seeks to achieve their version of a more ideal life, and this course extends that concept to an ideal society.
Absolutely. This is an amazing class that is discussion based and the teacher is very passionate. The teacher was also absolutely amazing, could not recommend more.
Yes. Very fun and very interesting.
Yes, this is a very niche topic to learn however it can be applied to many modern socioeconomic issues we deal with today. You truly gain a worldly view after this course.
